story:
Once upon a time in a beautiful village in Nigeria, there lived a young boy named Kola. Kola was a brave and curious child who loved to explore the world around him. Each night, before he went to bed, Kola's father would tell him stories of the great animals that roamed the African plains.

One evening, as Kola lay in bed, he asked his father, "Tell me a story about the wise old elephant, Dad." His father smiled and began:

"In the heart of the savannah, there lived an elephant named Tembo. Tembo was known for his wisdom and kindness towards all creatures big and small. He would offer guidance and protection to those in need, using his immense strength for good."

"Wow, Dad, I wish I could be as wise and kind as Tembo," Kola exclaimed.

His father nodded and continued, "One day, a fierce storm swept through the savannah, causing chaos and destruction. Many animals were in danger, and they all sought refuge with Tembo. Without hesitation, the wise elephant sheltered them under his massive body, keeping them safe until the storm passed."

Kola listened intently, his eyes wide with wonder. His father concluded the story by saying, "Tembo's actions taught us that true strength comes not from power alone but from kindness and compassion towards others."

With that, Kola's father tucked him into bed, and Kola drifted off to sleep, dreaming of the wise old elephant and the valuable lessons he had learned.

And so, every night, Kola's father would share tales of courage, kindness, and friendship with his son, nurturing his young mind and instilling in him the virtues that would guide him on his own adventures in the world.

Goodnight, young Kola. Sleep well, and may your dreams be filled with the spirit of wisdom and kindness.
